fullText: The show is a triumph of theatrical imagination, using ingenious staging to make us see the world through the eyes of its autistic protagonist.
dtliExcerpt: The show is a triumph of theatrical imagination, using ingenious staging to make us see the world through the eyes of its autistic protagonist.
bwwExcerpt: That combination of intense emotionalism and visual dazzle is captured brilliantly in Marianne Elliott's production, awash in video projections and moving parts (the ingenious grid-lined set is by Bunny Christie). Simon Stephens's lean, fast-moving adaptation makes smart use of the ensemble to create a polyphony of voices for narrative heavy lifting, while his domestic scenes don't stint on grimness.
